<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// categorize scalar expressions in loops.  It specializes in recognizing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// general induction variables, representing them with the abstract and opaque</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class represents an analyzed expression in the program.  These are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">/// opaque objects that the client is not allowed to do much with directly.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ace7f137cfb19ce8073b78b85f819430c">SCEV</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a368e3de8ea854f34bc97c21a64d6a164">FoldingSetNode</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">friend</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/foldingsettrait">FoldingSetTrait</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ace7f137cfb19ce8073b78b85f819430c">SCEV</a>&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A reference to an Interned FoldingSetNodeID for this node.  The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ScalarEvolution&#39;s BumpPtrAllocator holds the data.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/foldingsetnodeidref">FoldingSetNodeIDRef</a> FastID;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The SCEV baseclass this node corresponds to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad409632178dd00316abd4c35d3e14b5e">SCEVTypes</a> SCEVType;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">protected</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Estimated complexity of this node&#39;s expression tree size.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">short</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This field is initialized to zero and may be used in subclasses to store</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// miscellaneous information.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ade1f1b89affe842dacd20c7f950e99c9"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">short</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ade1f1b89affe842dacd20c7f950e99c9">SubclassData</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// NoWrapFlags are bitfield indices into SubclassData.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add and Mul expressions may have no-unsigned-wrap &lt;NUW&gt; or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// no-signed-wrap &lt;NSW&gt; properties, which are derived from the IR</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operator. NSW is a misnomer that we use to mean no signed overflow or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// underflow.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// AddRec expressions may have a no-self-wraparound &lt;NW&gt; property if, in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the integer domain, abs(step) &#42; max-iteration(loop) &lt;=</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// unsigned-max(bitwidth).  This means that the recurrence will never reach</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// its start value if the step is non-zero.  Computing the same value on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// each iteration is not considered wrapping, and recurrences with step = 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// are trivially &lt;NW&gt;.  &lt;NW&gt; is independent of the sign of step and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// value the add recurrence starts with.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note that NUW and NSW are also valid properties of a recurrence, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// either implies NW. For convenience, NW will be set for a recurrence</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// whenever either NUW or NSW are set.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// We require that the flag on a SCEV apply to the entire scope in which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that SCEV is defined.  A SCEV&#39;s scope is set of locations dominated by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a defining location, which is in turn described by the following rules:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#42; A SCEVUnknown is at the point of definition of the Value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#42; A SCEVConstant is defined at all points.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#42; A SCEVAddRec is defined starting with the header of the associated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#42; All other SCEVs are defined at the earlest point all operands are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   defined.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The above rules describe a maximally hoisted form (without regards to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// potential control dependence).  A SCEV is defined anywhere a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// corresponding instruction could be defined in said maximally hoisted</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// form.  Note that SCEVUDivExpr (currently the only expression type which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// can trap) can be defined per these rules in regions where it would trap</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// at runtime.  A SCEV being defined does not require the existence of any</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instruction within the defined scope.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f">NoWrapFlags</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa23e74052c4d79cfdaa23460a3c946656"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa23e74052c4d79cfdaa23460a3c946656">FlagAnyWrap</a> = 0,    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No guarantee.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faf763167030e97d18e8f8c8ed3dba28e3"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faf763167030e97d18e8f8c8ed3dba28e3">FlagNW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 0),  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No self-wrap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faafb62cd6afdc004ef6e8a1f6288eb382"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faafb62cd6afdc004ef6e8a1f6288eb382">FlagNUW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 1), </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No unsigned wrap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa2f7a8775a783f7ea3ad24b3f9cb5d949"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa2f7a8775a783f7ea3ad24b3f9cb5d949">FlagNSW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 2), </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No signed wrap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fae022582ed4b56bdb108b4488809e11e6"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fae022582ed4b56bdb108b4488809e11e6">NoWrapMask</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 3) - 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ace7f137cfb19ce8073b78b85f819430c"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">explicit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ace7f137cfb19ce8073b78b85f819430c">SCEV</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/foldingsetnodeidref">FoldingSetNodeIDRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad409632178dd00316abd4c35d3e14b5e">SCEVTypes</a> SCEVTy,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">                </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">short</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">      : FastID(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>), SCEVType(SCEVTy), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Returns estimated size of the mathematical expression represented by this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SCEV. The rules of its calculation are following:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1) Size of a SCEV without operands (like constants and SCEVUnknown) is 1;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2) Size SCEV with operands Op1, Op2, ..., OpN is calculated by formula:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    (1 + Size(Op1) + ... + Size(OpN)).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This value gives us an estimation of time we need to traverse through this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SCEV and all its operands recursively. We may use it to avoid performing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// heavy transformations on SCEVs of excessive size for sake of saving the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// compilation time.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a102c99af586cd76e0d9ff32ac0e825e0"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">short</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a102c99af586cd76e0d9ff32ac0e825e0">getExpressionSize</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Specialize FoldingSetTrait for SCEV to avoid needing to compute</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// temporary FoldingSetNodeID values.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class represents an assumption made on an AddRec expression. Given an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="comment">/// affine AddRec expression &#123;a,+,b&#125;, we assume that it has the nssw or nusw</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="comment">/// flags (defined below) in the first X iterations of the loop, where X is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SCEV expression returned by getPredicatedBackedgeTakenCount).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that this does not imply that X is equal to the backedge taken</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="comment">/// count. This means that if we have a nusw predicate for i32 &#123;0,+,1&#125; with a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="comment">/// predicated backedge taken count of X, we only guarantee that &#123;0,+,1&#125; has</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="comment">/// nusw in the first X iterations. &#123;0,+,1&#125; may still wrap in the loop if we</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="comment">/// have more than X iterations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a1434e18d5ff272c4b7bfb27e519dee42">SCEVWrapPredicate</a> final : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevpredicate/#a6d2a13cb997f4164ed8d17c16b50acf1">SCEVPredicate</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Similar to SCEV::NoWrapFlags, but with slightly different semantics</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for FlagNUSW. The increment is considered to be signed, and a + b</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (where b is the increment) is considered to wrap if:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    zext(a + b) != zext(a) + sext(b)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If Signed is a function that takes an n-bit tuple and maps to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// integer domain as the tuples value interpreted as twos complement,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and Unsigned a function that takes an n-bit tuple and maps to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// integer domain as the base two value of input tuple, then a + b</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// has IncrementNUSW iff:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 0 &lt;= Unsigned(a) + Signed(b) &lt; 2^n</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The IncrementNSSW flag has identical semantics with SCEV::FlagNSW.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note that the IncrementNUSW flag is not commutative: if base + inc</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// has IncrementNUSW, then inc + base doesn&#39;t neccessarily have this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// property. The reason for this is that this is used for sign/zero</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// extending affine AddRec SCEV expressions when a SCEVWrapPredicate is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// assumed. A &#123;base,+,inc&#125; expression is already non-commutative with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// regards to base and inc, since it is interpreted as:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     (((base + inc) + inc) + inc) ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70">IncrementWrapFlags</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a11c850531be360193c9473b4fe240c1d"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a11c850531be360193c9473b4fe240c1d">IncrementAnyWrap</a> = 0,     </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No guarantee.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a17e825823d4b6a92c1b221c4460c91a3"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a17e825823d4b6a92c1b221c4460c91a3">IncrementNUSW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 0), </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No unsigned with signed increment wrap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70aa4c321f736f542d50b81bb06351f7fce"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70aa4c321f736f542d50b81bb06351f7fce">IncrementNSSW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 1), </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No signed with signed increment wrap</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="normal">                              </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (equivalent with SCEV::NSW)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a230598aea93080d7f8204727504352e7"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a230598aea93080d7f8204727504352e7">IncrementNoWrapMask</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 2) - 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if there exists a point in the program at which both</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A and B could be operands to the same instruction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SCEV expressions are generally assumed to correspond to instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// which could exists in IR.  In general, this requires that there exists</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a use point in the program where all operands dominate the use.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     loop &#123; v1 = load @global1; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   else</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     loop &#123; v2 = load @global2; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// No SCEV with operand V1, and v2 can exist in this program.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a744bc2c6ff2e83909955ef714890cb14">instructionCouldExistWithOperands</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if the SCEV is a scAddRecExpr or it contains</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// scAddRecExpr. The result will be cached in HasRecMap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a62b3c09f031f2478ebd6c92b8c80aa2f">containsAddRecurrence</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;S);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Is operation \\p BinOp between \\p LHS and \\p RHS provably does not have</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a signed/unsigned overflow (\\p Signed)? If \\p CtxI is specified, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// no-overflow fact should be true in the context of this instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the largest constant divisor of the trip count as a normal</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// always a multiple of the returned value. Returns 1 if the trip count is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// unknown or not guaranteed to be the multiple of a constant., Will also</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// return 1 if the trip count is very large (&gt;= 2^32).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note that the argument is an exit count for loop L, NOT a trip count.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a29ee697fe94374eae9689321e811f5e9">getSmallConstantTripMultiple</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;ExitCount);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="841"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the largest constant divisor of the trip count of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop.  Will return 1 if no trip count could be computed, or if a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="843"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// divisor could not be found.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a29ee697fe94374eae9689321e811f5e9">getSmallConstantTripMultiple</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the largest constant divisor of the trip count of this loop as a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// normal unsigned value, if possible. This means that the actual trip</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// count is always a multiple of the returned value (don&#39;t forget the trip</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="849"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// count could very well be zero as well!). As explained in the comments</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="850"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for getSmallConstantTripCount, this assumes that control exits the loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// via ExitingBlock.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a29ee697fe94374eae9689321e811f5e9">getSmallConstantTripMultiple</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;ExitingBlock);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The terms &quot;backedge taken count&quot; and &quot;exit count&quot; are used</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// interchangeably to refer to the number of times the backedge of a loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// has executed before the loop is exited.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecef"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecef">ExitCountKind</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// An expression exactly describing the number of times the backedge has</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// executed when a loop is exited.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="861" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecefab1761348a1f6ac41658c85ffdd2d9361"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecefab1761348a1f6ac41658c85ffdd2d9361">Exact</a>,</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="862"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// A constant which provides an upper bound on the exact trip count.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecefa707795ac384dd38bc1fc47cded39f5de"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecefa707795ac384dd38bc1fc47cded39f5de">ConstantMaximum</a>,</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// An expression which provides an upper bound on the exact trip count.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecefa007c52805d507c0cc6d53cbea782eaf4"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecefa007c52805d507c0cc6d53cbea782eaf4">SymbolicMaximum</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return the number of times the backedge executes before the given exit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// would be taken; if not exactly computable, return SCEVCouldNotCompute.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For a single exit loop, this value is equivelent to the result of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// getBackedgeTakenCount.  The loop is guaranteed to exit (via &#42;some&#42; exit)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// before the backedge is executed (ExitCount + 1) times.  Note that there</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is no guarantee about &#42;which&#42; exit is taken on the exiting iteration.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00883" /><CodeLine lineNumber="883"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="884"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the specified loop has a predictable backedge-taken count, return it,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="885"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// otherwise return a SCEVCouldNotCompute object. The backedge-taken count is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="886"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the number of times the loop header will be branched to from within the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00887" /><CodeLine lineNumber="887"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop, assuming there are no abnormal exists like exception throws. This is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="888"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// one less than the trip count of the loop, since it doesn&#39;t count the first</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="889"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// iteration, when the header is branched to from outside the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="890"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="891"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note that it is not valid to call this method on a loop without a</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This method should be called by the client when it made any change that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// would invalidate SCEV&#39;s answers, and the client wants to remove all loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// information held internally by ScalarEvolution. This is intended to be used</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when the alternative to forget a loop is too expensive (i.e. large loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bodies).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ac5f5c8803494a746eb35e42f67abd0ec">forgetAllLoops</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method should be called by the client when it has changed a loop in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a way that may effect ScalarEvolution&#39;s ability to compute a trip count,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Test if the given expression is known to be a power of 2  OrNegative</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// allows matching negative power of 2s, and OrZero allows matching 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#aa5e7bb544eab3ac6fa1f810ee068ab6b">isKnownToBeAPowerOfTwo</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;S, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> OrZero = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><Highlight kind="normal">                              </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> OrNegative = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Splits SCEV expression \\p S into two SCEVs. One of them is obtained from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\p S by substitution of all AddRec sub-expression related to loop \\p L</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// with initial value of that SCEV. The second is obtained from \\p S by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// substitution of all AddRec sub-expressions related to loop \\p L with post</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// increment of this AddRec in the loop \\p L. In both cases all other AddRec</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// sub-expressions (not related to \\p L) remain the same.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the \\p S contains non-invariant unknown SCEV the function returns</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// CouldNotCompute SCEV in both values of std::pair.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example, for SCEV S=&#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L1&gt; + &#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L2&gt; and loop L=L1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the function returns pair:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// first = &#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L2&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// second = &#123;1, +, 1&#125;&lt;L1&gt; + &#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L2&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// We can see that for the first AddRec sub-expression it was replaced with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 0 (initial value) for the first element and to &#123;1, +, 1&#125;&lt;L1&gt; (post</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// increment value) for the second one. In both cases AddRec expression</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// related to L2 remains the same.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::pair&lt;const SCEV &#42;, const SCEV &#42;&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ae7a40d693574be8048944e80774e6c1d">SplitIntoInitAndPostInc</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                                </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;S);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1065"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// We&#39;d like to check the predicate on every iteration of the most dominated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1067"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop between loops used in LHS and RHS.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1068"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// To do this we use the following list of steps:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1069"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 1 Collect set S all loops on which either LHS or RHS depend.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1070"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 2 If S is non-empty</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1071"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a. Let PD be the element of S which is dominated by all other elements.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1072"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// b. Let E(LHS) be value of LHS on entry of PD.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1073"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    To get E(LHS), we should just take LHS and replace all AddRecs that are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1074"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    attached to PD on with their entry values.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1075"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    Define E(RHS) in the same way.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1076"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// c. Let B(LHS) be value of L on backedge of PD.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1077"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    To get B(LHS), we should just take LHS and replace all AddRecs that are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1078"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    attached to PD on with their backedge values.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1079"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    Define B(RHS) in the same way.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1080"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// d. Note that E(LHS) and E(RHS) are automatically available on entry of PD,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1081"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    so we can assert on that.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1082"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// e. Return true if isLoopEntryGuardedByCond(Pred, E(LHS), E(RHS)) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1083"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                   isLoopBackedgeGuardedByCond(Pred, B(LHS), B(RHS))</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1084"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#afd0a71dc4e0ed5b83c50e875e6726661">isKnownViaInduction</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmppredicate">CmpPredicate</a> Pred, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1156"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1157"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Compute the number of times the backedge of the specified loop will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1158"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// execute if its exit condition were a conditional branch of ExitCond.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1159"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1160"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\p ControlsOnlyExit is true if ExitCond directly controls the only exit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1161"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// branch. In this case, we can assume that the loop exits only if the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1162"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// condition is true and can infer that failing to meet the condition prior</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1163"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to integer wraparound results in undefined behavior.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1164"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1165"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If \\p AllowPredicates is set, this call will try to use a minimal set of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1166"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SCEV predicates in order to return an exact answer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1170"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1171"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A predicate is said to be monotonically increasing if may go from being</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1172"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// false to being true as the loop iterates, but never the other way</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1173"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// around.  A predicate is said to be monotonically decreasing if may go</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1174"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// from being true to being false as the loop iterates, but never the other</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1175"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// way around.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1176" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a899d8027fa6af3ca29aae6d88b6050ef"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a899d8027fa6af3ca29aae6d88b6050ef">MonotonicPredicateType</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1177" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a899d8027fa6af3ca29aae6d88b6050efab8a33d7289e160c15fb2a8d84a3eade8"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a899d8027fa6af3ca29aae6d88b6050efab8a33d7289e160c15fb2a8d84a3eade8">MonotonicallyIncreasing</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1572"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1573"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Return an expression indicating the exact &#42;backedge-taken&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1574"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// count of the loop if it is known or SCEVCouldNotCompute</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1575"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// otherwise.  If execution makes it to the backedge on every</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1576"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// iteration (i.e. there are no abnormal exists like exception</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1577"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// throws and thread exits) then this is the number of times the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1578"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// loop header will execute minus one.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1579"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1580"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If the SCEV predicate associated with the answer can be different</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1581"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// from AlwaysTrue, we must add a (non null) Predicates argument.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1582"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The SCEV predicate associated with the answer will be added to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1583"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Predicates. A run-time check needs to be emitted for the SCEV</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1584"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// predicate in order for the answer to be valid.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1585"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1586"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Note that we should always know if we need to pass a predicate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1587"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// argument or not from the way the ExitCounts vector was computed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1588"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If we allowed SCEV predicates to be generated when populating this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1589"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// vector, this information can contain them and therefore a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1590"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// SCEVPredicate argument should be added to getExact.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1594"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1595"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Return the number of times this loop exit may fall through to the back</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1596"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// edge, or SCEVCouldNotCompute. The loop is guaranteed not to exit via</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1597"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// this block before this number of iterations, but may exit via another</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1598"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// block. If \\p Predicates is null the function returns CouldNotCompute if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1599"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// predicates are required, otherwise it fills in the required predicates.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2193"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if the SCEV corresponding to \\p I is never poison.  Proving</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2194"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this is more complex than proving that just \\p I is never poison, since</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2195"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SCEV commons expressions across control flow, and you can have cases</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2196"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// like:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2197"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2198"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   idx0 = a + b;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2199"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ptr&#91;idx0&#93; = 100;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2200"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   if (&lt;condition&gt;) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2201"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     idx1 = a +nsw b;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2202"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     ptr&#91;idx1&#93; = 200;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2203"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2204"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2205"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// where the SCEV expression (+ a b) is guaranteed to not be poison (and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2206"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// hence not sign-overflow) only if &quot;&lt;condition&gt;&quot; is true.  Since both</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2207"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#96;idx0&#96; and &#96;idx1&#96; will be mapped to the same SCEV expression, (+ a b),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2208"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it is not okay to annotate (+ a b) with &lt;nsw&gt; in the above example.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2209"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> isSCEVExprNeverPoison(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2210"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2211"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is like \\c isSCEVExprNeverPoison but it specifically works for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2212"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instructions that will get mapped to SCEV add recurrences.  Return true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2213"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if \\p I will never generate poison under the assumption that \\p I is an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2214"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// add recurrence on the loop \\p L.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2216"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2217"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Similar to createAddRecFromPHI, but with the additional flexibility of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2218"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// suggesting runtime overflow checks in case casts are encountered.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2219"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If successful, the analysis records that for this loop, \\p SymbolicPHI,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2369"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2370"><Highlight kind="comment">/// An interface layer with SCEV used to manage how we see SCEV expressions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2371"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for values in the context of existing predicates. We can add new</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2372"><Highlight kind="comment">/// predicates, but we cannot remove them.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2373"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2374"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This layer has multiple purposes:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2375"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - provides a simple interface for SCEV versioning.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2376"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - guarantees that the order of transformations applied on a SCEV</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2377"><Highlight kind="comment">///     expression for a single Value is consistent across two different</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2378"><Highlight kind="comment">///     getSCEV calls. This means that, for example, once we&#39;ve obtained</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2379"><Highlight kind="comment">///     an AddRec expression for a certain value through expression</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2380"><Highlight kind="comment">///     rewriting, we will continue to get an AddRec expression for that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2381"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2382"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - lowers the number of expression rewrites.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2383" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution/#aa2b11e914798a4e54c7e640722f1b08d">PredicatedScalarEvolution</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2384"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2385"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution/#aa2b11e914798a4e54c7e640722f1b08d">PredicatedScalarEvolution</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &amp;L);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2386"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2387"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevpredicate">SCEVPredicate</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution/#a12a8ac8838fb851a2de5dc5275307bb6">getPredicate</a>() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2391"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// returned by ScalarEvolution is guaranteed to be preserved, even when</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2392"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// adding new predicates.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2393"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution/#ae0994d8207b94ad22ecebc1a6bc580f1">getSCEV</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V);</Highlight></CodeLine>
